provis.src.plotting package

The plotting package includes the two classes that handle plotting.

One can simply call the member functions of these classes to plot and everything will be done automatically.

provis.src.plotting.structure module

class provis.src.plotting.structure.Structure(notebook=False)

Bases: object

The Structure class is used to visualize the structural information of the given molecule. One can easily plot the atoms, residues, bonds or any combination of these.

manual_plot(atoms=0, col_a=0, box=0, bonds=0, vw=0, residues=0, col_r=0, res=0, bb=0, outname=0)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – atoms - List of pyvista Shperes representing each atom, default: 0.

  • type – list, optional

  • name – col_a - List of colors for each atom, default: 0.

  • type – list, optional

  • name – box - If True bounding box also visualized, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – bonds - List of pyvista Lines representing each bond, default: 0.

  • type – list, optional

  • name – vw - If True styling for Van-der-Waals plotting set. Vw atomic objects still have to be passed under ‘atoms’ variable.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – res - List of pyvista Shperes representing each residue, default: 0.

  • type – list, optional

  • name – col_r - List of colors for each residue, default: 0.

  • type – list, optional

  • name – res - Specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them.

  • type – Residue, optional

  • name – bb - List of coordinates describing the back-bone of the protein, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. default: data/img/{self._name}_stick_point.

  • type – string, optional

Returns

Pyvista.Plotter window - Window with interactive plot

plot(atoms=0, box=0, bonds=0, vw=0, residues=0, res=None, bb=0, outname=0, title=None)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – atoms - Plot atoms, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – bonds, optional - Plot bond. If zero or undefined then it does not plot the bonds, if 1 it plots all bonds uniformly, if 2 it plots colorful bonds (see data_handler). Default: 0.

  • type – int, optional

  • name – vw - Plot Wan-der-Waals radii instead of atomic radii.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – residues, optional - Plot residue, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – res - Residues passed in ‘res’ will be plotted with a bounding box around them. Defaults to None.

  • type – Residue, optional

  • name – bb - If True backbone of protein is plotted. Default: False.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – outname - Save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. Defaults to data/img/{pdb_id}_stick_point.png.

  • type – string, optional

  • name – title - Title of the plot window. Defaults to None.

  • type – str, optional

Returns

Pyvista.Plotter window - Window with interactive plot

plot_atoms(box=0, r=0, outname=0)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – res - Residues passed in ‘res’ will be plotted with a bounding box around them. Defaults to None.

  • type – Residue, optional

  • name – outname - Save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. Defaults to data/img/{pdb_id}_atoms.png.

  • type – string, optional

Returns

Pyvista.Plotter window - Window with interactive plot.

  • name – outname - Save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. Defaults to data/img/{pdb_id}_atoms.png.

plot_bonds(colorful=False, box=0, r=0, outname=0)

Plot bonds only

Parameters

  • name – colorful - If True bonds will be plotted in a colorful manner. If False all bonds are white. Default: False

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – box - If True bounding box also visualized, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – res - Residues passed in ‘res’ will be plotted with a bounding box around them. Defaults to None.

  • type – Residue, optional

  • name – outname - Save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. Defaults to data/img/{pdb_id}_atoms.png.

  • type – string, optional

Returns

Pyvista.Plotter window - Window with interactive plot.

  • name – res - Residues passed in ‘res’ will be plotted with a bounding box around them. Defaults to None.

plot_vw(box=0, r=0, outname=0)

Plot Van-der-Waals atoms

Parameters

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default: 0.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – res - Residues passed in ‘res’ will be plotted with a bounding box around them. Defaults to None.

  • type – Residue, optional

  • name – outname - Save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. Defaults to data/img/{pdb_id}_atoms.png.

  • type – string, optional

Returns

Pyvista.Plotter window - Window with interactive plot.

provis.src.plotting.surface module

class provis.src.plotting.surface.Surface(dens=None, msms=False, notebook=False)

Bases: object

The Surface class is used to visualize the surface information of the given molecule.

All member functions of the class are a “two in one” function: - plot the surface created by the MSMS binary. - create a good approximation of the surface natively with o3d and trimesh and plot it. MSMS does not have to be installed for this option. (It is slightly slower and less precise)

Choose between the two by setting the msms Boolean variable (True corresponding to the MSMS binary option is default)

plot_charge(outname=None)

Plot the charge features of a protein.

Parameters

  • name – outname - Save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/img directory. Defaults to data/img/{pdb_id}_charge.png.

  • type – string, optional

Returns

Pyvista.Plotter window - Window with interactive plot.

  • type – string, optional

Returns
